intro: Cremosperma parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered cremosperma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers arranged in whorls along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
